metadata.title: CVE-2016-9535 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
tif_predict.h and tif_predict.c in libtiff 4.0.6 have assertions that canlead to assertion failures in debug mode, or buffer overflows in releasemode, when dealing with unusual tile size like YCbCr with subsampling.Reported as MSVR 35105, aka "Predictor heap-buffer-overflow."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9535` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.1
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.1').
